column3: Full description
1.1. Restrictive measures in force based on Article 215 Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, insofar as they relate to trade in goods between the Union and third countries;
1.2. Total bans and prohibitions;
1.3. Trade defence instruments as set out in section 5 of Annex 2 to the Protocol;
1.4. Union tariff rate quotas when the quota is claimed by the importer;
1.5. Union quotas other than tariff rate quotas.
2.1. Regulation (EC) No 273/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 February 2004 on drug precursors

column3: 2.24. Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2006 concerning the Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH), establishing a European Chemicals Agency, amending Directive 1999/45/EC and repealing Council Regulation (EEC) No 793/93 and Commission Regulation (EC) No 1488/94 as well as Council Directive 76/769/EEC and Commission Directives 91/155/EEC, 93/67/EEC, 93/105/EC and 2000/21/EC
2.25. Regulation (EU) 2019/880 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the introduction and the import of cultural goods

2.26. Any Union act as applying to and in the United Kingdom in respect of Northern Ireland in accordance with the Protocol which provides for any steps which must be carried out by an economic operator or by a partner competent authority prior to, or when, goods enter the Union, for the purpose of controlling the goods or controlling other formalities. The Union shall inform without delay the United Kingdom where a Union act is of the nature referred to in the first sentence.
